ACTIONet.tools package¶

Submodules¶

ACTIONet.tools.aa module¶

ACTIONet.tools.aa.aa(A: numpy.ndarray, k: int, max_iter: Optional[int] = 50, min_delta: Optional[float] = 1e-16) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]¶

Archetypal Analysis (AA)

Runs SPA algorithm to solve separable NMF problem.

Parameters

  • A – Input matrix

  • k – Number of archetypes to consider

  • max_it – Define stopping conditions

  • min_delta – Define stopping conditions

Returns

  • C – Convex matrix of archetype coefficients (# observations x # archetypes)

  • H – Convex matrix of observation coefficients (# archetypes x # observations)

ACTIONet.tools.imputation module¶

ACTIONet.tools.imputation.impute_genes_using_archetypes(adata: anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, genes: list, archetypes_key: Optional[str] = 'H_unified') → anndata._core.anndata.AnnData¶

Impute expression of genes by interpolating over archetype profile

Parameters

  • adata – AnnData object storing the ACTIONet results

  • genes – List of genes to impute

  • archetypes_key – Key in adata.obsm that holds the archetype footprints

Returns

cells x genes

Return type

AnnData

ACTIONet.tools.imputation.impute_genes_using_network(adata: anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, genes: list, alpha: Optional[float] = 0.85, thread_no: Optional[int] = 0, n_iters: Optional[int] = 5) → anndata._core.anndata.AnnData¶
ACTIONet.tools.imputation.impute_specific_genes_using_archetypes(adata: anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, genes: list, archetypes_key: Optional[str] = 'H_unified', significance: Optional[Literal[upper, lower]] = 'upper') → anndata._core.anndata.AnnData¶

Impute expression of genes by interpolating over archetype profile

Parameters

  • adata – AnnData object storing the ACTIONet results

  • genes – List of genes to impute

  • archetypes_key – Key in adata.obsm that holds the archetype footprints

  • significance – Whether to use upper or lower significant genes.

Returns

cells x genes

Return type

AnnData

ACTIONet.tools.networktools module¶

ACTIONet.tools.networktools.run_LPA(G: numpy.ndarray, labels: numpy.ndarray, lambda_val: Optional[float] = 1, max_iter: Optional[int] = 3, sig_threshold: Optional[int] = 3, fixed_labels: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, list]] = array([], dtype=float64)) → [<class ‘numpy.ndarray’>]¶

ACTIONet.tools.regression module¶

ACTIONet.tools.regression.run_simplex_regression(A: numpy.ndarray, B: numpy.ndarray, computeXtX: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray¶

Simplex-Constrained Regression (AX-B).

Solves the linear regression problem, subject to coefficients being positive and sum to one.

Parameters

  • A – Matrix of independent variables (design matrix)

  • B – Matrix of dependent variables (response variable)

  • computeXtX – Parameter to simplex regression

Returns

Coefficient matrix

Return type

X

ACTIONet.tools.spa module¶

ACTIONet.tools.spa.spa(A: Union[numpy.ndarray, scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix], k: int) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]¶

Successive Projection Algorithm (SPA).

Runs SPA algorithm to solve separable NMF problem.

Parameters

  • A – Matrix matrix

  • k – Number of columns to select

Returns

  • selected_columns – Index of k selected columns

  • norms – Residual norm of selected columns

ACTIONet.tools.svd module¶

ACTIONet.tools.svd.svd(X: Union[numpy.ndarray, scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix], dim: int, solver: Literal[irlb, feng, halko] = 'halko', n_iters: Optional[int] = None, seed: int = 0) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]¶

Randomized singular value decomposition (SVD) :param X:Input matrix (dense or sparse) :param dim: Target dimensions :param solver:SVD solver to use: ‘irlb’ randomized SVD used in IRLBA R package ‘feng’ randomized SVD from Feng et al. ‘halko’ (the default) randomized SVD from Halko et al. :param n_iters: Maximum number of iterations. Defaults to 1000 for irlb and 5 otherwise. :param seed: Random seed … :return U: Matrix of left singular vectors :return sigma: Matrix of singular values :return V: Matrix of right singular vectors
